intro: Phacelia cliffordii, commonly known as clifford's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features slender stems and produces clusters of small, pale blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. It is often found in chaparral and sagebrush habitats, blooming in late spring to early summer.
